markdownRemark.html:
Back in Nov 2018, I got this bag as a (late but still better than nothing) birthday gift from my sister (Thanks sis ğŸ˜˜), and after 9 months of abuse, hereâ€™s a quick list of what I like and donâ€™t like about it.

ğŸ‘ Organizations

Itâ€™s really nice to have proper compartments to keep things separate & stay in place

ğŸ‘ Downward-facing compartment

However, one of the â€œeasy-accessâ€ compartment just so happens to face down, and itâ€™s not too difficult to forgot to zip it up. Thatâ€™s how I lost the case to my wireless earbuds ğŸ˜­

ğŸ‘ Capacity

Itâ€™s really nice to be able to put a laptop, tablet, mouse, charger, wallet, keys, a down jacket, and more, and still being able to shove a few nicknacks in there.

ğŸ‘ Weight

However, as a weakling, itâ€™s not really comfortable to carry so many stuff on a messenger bag. It press against my chest, and not to mention how tiresome it can be for my shoulder.

ğŸ‘ Looks

Would you just look at that ğŸ¤©

ğŸ‘ Materials

While the material is not terrible, There are quite a few things left to be desire. The Velcro is biggest gripe: itâ€™s noisy, it wears out relatively quickly, and it also take a few other things down with it (e.g. the part that holds the clips up).

And for the cordura nylon body, it mostly keep rain & moisture out, it mostly stay intact, and itâ€™s also doing a decent job on â€œnot making dusts looks very visibleâ€. However, I have found 1 hole, locations in where the corner of my laptop sits. And itâ€™s not even after a year, so thatâ€™s kinda disappointing. I probably should see if itâ€™s cover under any warrantyâ€¦â€¦

ğŸ‘ Key chain

This is less of a thumbs down, more of an â€œehhhhhhhhhâ€: the keychain is good in theory, but itâ€™s kinda too short to be useful in enough situations. Also the release mechanism is not exactly convenient, and itâ€™s now easier to just store the keys in that compartment without using the key chain ğŸ¤·â€â™€ï¸

Conclusion

7.5/10 good enough for 90 euros.
